thread.title: EastEnders fans thrilled when June Brown's onscreen son John Altman interrupts TV tribute filming with flowers
thread.title_full: EastEnders fans thrilled when June Brown's onscreen son John Altman interrupts TV tribute filming with flowers

author: Lara Martin
title: EastEnders fans thrilled when June Brown's onscreen son John Altman interrupts TV tribute filming with flowers
text:
EastEnders fans thrilled when June Brown's onscreen son John Altman interrupts TV tribute filming with flowers Mother and son reunited again! Share Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
EastEnders fans were thrilled when June Brown was reunited with her onscreen son John Altman - aka Nasty Nick - during Thursday’s special tribute show. 
The actress - who has played Dot Branning since 1985 - had been talking about her first day on the EastEnders set when a man interrupted filming brandishing a huge bouquet of flowers. 
“I’m sorry to interrupt,” said the mystery man. 
“I have a flower delivery here for June Cotton," he said. "Dorothy Brown. Dorothy Branning. I mixed the name up, rather.” June was stunned when her chat was interrupted (Photo: BBC) The man's identity was hidden behind set equipment and the flowers (Photo: BBC) He pretended to get June's name wrong (Photo: BBC) She was thrilled when the flower delivery man was revealed as John! (Photo: BBC) Read More 
A stunned June watched on as the man got closer, the flowers covering his face. 
“Who is it?” asked June. 
“It’s Johnny!" came the reply as John revealed his face. 
June was thrilled, giving her onscreen son a big hug before they sat down together to reminisce about old times. 
In one poignant moment, John said: “My real ma is gone, you’re the only ma I have left.” Kisses for her onscreen son (Photo: BBC) The pair are firm friends (Photo: BBC) They reminisced about the past (Photo: BBC) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
